BusinessName.BusinessNameLine1Txt: Connecticut Business and Industry Association Inc

IRS990.ActivityOrMissionDesc: CBIA is the voice of business in Connecticut, with thousands of member companies championing change at the state capitol, shaping debate about economic competitiveness and fighting for a better future for all.
IRS990.MissionDesc: CBIA is the voice of business in Connecticut, with thousands of member companies championing change at the State Capitol, shaping debate about economic competitiveness and fighting for a better future for all.
IRS990.Desc: CBIA represents the interests of its members at the state capitol by employing registered lobbyists; hosting meetings and company tours to facilitate communication between CBIA members and their elected state officials; sponsoring events at the state capitol to highlight the importance of business and manufacturing to the state's economy; and sponsoring councils to encourage member involvement in the legislative process.

ProgSrvcAccomActy2Grp.Desc: CBIA communicates with its members and the public by publishing newsletters and email alerts on issues affecting business while the state legislature is in session; using print, broadcast, and social media to educate members and the general public on business-related public policy issues; publishing articles and opinion pieces in Connecticut newspapers; and maintaining a content-rich website.

ProgSrvcAccomActy3Grp.Desc: CBIA helps its members compete in a global economy by offering a free telephone service to members on human resource and other compliance issues; sponsoring events to educate members on business and economic issues; publishing newsletters on human resource, health and safety issues; and publishing surveys and other reports on economic and business topics.

Form990PartVIISectionAGrp.TitleTxt: CBIA SECRETARY AND SERVICE CORP PRESIDENT

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Schedule D, Part X, Line 2 FIN 48 (ASC 740) footnote
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: CBIA is a tax-exempt organizations under Section 501(c)(6) of the Internal Revenue Code and, except to the extent CBIA has unrelated business income, is exempt from federal income taxes. There was no provision for income taxes due on unrelated business income in fiscal year 2023 and 2022. CBIA recognizes a tax benefit from an uncertain tax position only if it is more likely than not that the tax position will be sustained on examination by the taxing authorities. Management evaluated CBIA's tax positions and concluded that CBIA had no material uncertainties in income taxes as of June 30, 2023 and 2022.

RltdOrgOfficerTrstKeyEmplGrp.TitleTxt: CBIA SECRETARY AND SERVICE CORP PRESIDENT

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Schedule J, Part I, Line 1a Travel for companions
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: CBIA provides travel for companions when there is a valid business purpose for their attendance at out of town meetings. Given that there is a bonafide business purpose, the organization does not tax employees on travel for companions.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part VI, Line 1a Delegate broad authority to a committee
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: ARTICLE VI, SECTION 1 OF THE BY-LAWS PROVIDE THAT THERE SHALL BE AN EXECUTIVE COMMITTEE OF THE BOARD OF DIRECTORS CONSISTING OF THE CHAIR, BOTH VICE CHAIRS, THE PRESIDENT AND CEO, THE IMMEDIATE PAST CHAIR, AND EIGHT ADDITIONAL MEMBERS OF THE BOARD OF DIRECTORS APPOINTED BY THE BOARD OF DIRECTORS. DURING THE INTERVALS BETWEEN THE MEETINGS OF THE BOARD OF DIRECTORS AND SUBJECT TO SUCH LIMITATIONS ASMAY BE PRESCRIBED BY THE BOARD OF DIRECTORS, THE EXECUTIVE COMMITTEE SHALL HAVE AND MAY EXERCISE ALL THE POWERS AND AUTHORITY OF THE BOARD OF DIRECTORS TO THE MAXIMUM EXTENT PERMITTED BY LAW, EXCEPT THAT THE EXECUTIVE COMMITTEE SHALL NOT HAVE THE POWER TO AMEND THE BYLAWS.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part VI, Line 6 Classes of members or stockholders
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: CBIA IS A BUSINESS MEMBERSHIP ORGANIZATION WITH APPROXIMATELY 4,000 MEMBERS. There are two classes of members designated as active members and associate members. Active membership shall be limited to sole proprietorships, partnerships, corporations and other entities engaged in any business within the State of Connecticut. Each active member in good standing shall be entitled to one vote for the election of directors and on all other matters which come before the members for action. For purposes of the Form 990, the active members are the members of the organization. Associate membership shall be limited to nonprofit associations and institutions, chambers of commerce, and such other entities or persons as are approved by the board of directors. Associate members shall have no right to vote for the election of directors or any other matters of any nature whatsoever which may come before CBIA.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part VI, Line 7a Members or stockholders electing members of governing body
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: CBIA's board of directors is elected by active members of the corporation in good standing.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part VI, Line 11b Review of form 990 by governing body
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: Officers of CBIA reviewed the Form 990 in December 2023, prior to filing. CBIA's audit committee was also provided copies of the Form 990 for review. CBIA's compensation committee reported the results of their review to the CBIA board of directors. The Form 990 is made available to other board members upon request.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part VI, Line 12c Conflict of interest policy
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: All CBIA employees, officers and directors are required to complete a conflict of interest statement annually. CBIA's Treasurer and Director of HR review the employees' statements. CBIA's President and Assistant Secretary review the officers directors' statements and work with the board and management to resolve any conflicts.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part VI, Line 15a Process to establish compensation of top management official
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: The compensation committee establishes the compensation for CBIA's President. The committee reviews salary surveys and data provided by an independent compensation consultant to establish appropriate compensation. The committee follows a documented compensation philosophy. The committee also administers the variable pay plan by reviewing objectives and benchmarks at the beginning of each fiscal year and evaluating performance and approving awards at the end of each fiscal year.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part VI, Line 15b Process to establish compensation of other employees
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: The compensation committee establishes the compensation for CBIA's senior vice presidents. The committee reviews salary surveys and data provided by an independent compensation consultant to establish appropriate compensation plans for these employees. The committee follows a documented compensation philosophy. The committee also administers the variable pay plans for these employees by reviewing objectives and benchmarks at the beginning of each fiscal year and evaluating performance and approving awards at the end of each fiscal year.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part VI, Line 19 Required documents available to the public
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: CBIA's governing documents are filed with the Connecticut Secretary of State and are a matter of public record. CBIA's conflict of interest policy and financial statements are available to members upon request.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part XI, Line 9 Other changes in net assets or fund balances
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: Pension-related changes other than periodic pension costs - 1473893; Equity in loss of subsidiary - -173217;
